title:
Taming NSPT fluctuations in $O(N)$ Non-Linear Sigma Model: simulations
  in the large $N$ regime
authors: Paolo Baglioni and Francesco Di Renzo
abstract:
The Non-Linear Sigma Model (NLSM) is an example of a field theory on a target
space exhibiting intricate geometry. One remarkable characteristic of the NLSM
is asymptotic freedom, which triggers interest in perturbative calculations. In
the lattice formulation of NLSM, one would naturally rely on Numerical
Stochastic Perturbation Theory (NSPT) to conduct high-order computations.
However, when dealing with low-dimensional systems, NSPT reveals increasing
statistical fluctuations with higher and higher orders. This of course does not
come as a surprise and one is ready to live with this, as long as the noise is
not going to completely kill the signal, which unfortunately in some models
does take place. We investigate how, in the $O(N)$ context, this behaviour
strongly depends on $N$. As expected, larger $N$ values make higher-order
computations feasible.
